title: HPVTC cultivating talent, benefiting local community
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):Huaneng Pakistan Vocational and Technical College (HPVTC) set up inside Sahiwal Coal Power Plant is cultivating talent, benefiting the local community, promoting a positive image, culture of the workplace and fostering harmony.
Focal person of Sahiwal Coal Power Plant, said that a technical training agreement was signed between the Punjab Government and the Power Plant, leading to the establishment of a well-developed, clean, and green vocational and technical college.
Technical education is the cornerstone of a skilled workforce, especially in industries requiring specialized knowledge and practical expertise, the Focal person said in a statement issued here Tuesday.
The establishment of Huaneng Pakistan Vocational and Technical College (HPVTC) brings substantial benefits to local students by providing access to specialized education, opening up career opportunities, and fostering economic growth within the community. This institution also offers opportunities for fresh graduates from universities and college students nearing the end of their academic programs. Each new batch of students is enrolled based on a rigorous selection process, with training sessions starting consecutively as each previous batch completes their program.
Huaneng Pakistan Vocational and Technical College (HPVTC) offers a variety of technical courses, including computer skills, electrical and mechanical training, safety and rescue procedures, welding, Chinese and English language studies, and basic knowledge of power plant operations.
HPVTC also offers internships programs to fresh graduates and university students, allowing them to come and gain technical education and practical skills during a specified internship period.
As a key player in energy production and distribution, Sahiwal Coal Power Plant relies on a workforce proficient in various technical disciplines. This technical training college equips students with the essential skills and knowledge needed to excel in this industry.
For local students, the ability to gain valuable expertise close to home offers a significant advantage, paving the way for personal success and the overall betterment of their community.
They also experience a collaborative learning environment, a positive and enriching culture, and teamwork. A technical education training college focused on power plant operations offers college students, university students, and fresh graduates an unparalleled opportunity to gain the specialized skills and practical experience essential for success in the energy sector.
It is pertinent to mention here, Sahiwal Coal Fired Power Plant is one of the major projects of China-Pak Economic Corridor (CPEC) and Belt Road Initiative (BRI).
